item.title: Creating a Profile
item.description: This tutorial covers creating and modifying a subset of controls from a catalog in OSCAL by using the OSCAL profile model. Such a subset of controls is often referred to as a "control baseline". Before reading this tutorial you should: Have some familiarity with the XML, JSON, or YAML formats. Review the OSCAL control layer overview. Review the OSCAL catalog and profile model overview pages. Review the tutorial on Creating a Control Catalog.

item.title: Creating a Control Catalog
item.description: This tutorial covers creating a basic OSCAL control catalog. Before reading this tutorial you should: Have some familiarity with the XML, JSON, or YAML formats. Read the OSCAL control layer overview. Review the OSCAL catalog model overview. What is an OSCAL Catalog? A catalog is a collection of security and privacy controls, and related control enhancements. An OSCAL Control Catalog is a machine-readable representation of a catalog, expressed using the OSCAL Catalog model, which includes contextualizing documentation and metadata.
